info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued March 30 at 4:07AM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...FREEZING RAIN CONTINUES THIS MORNING & THIS AFTERNOON...
.Ongoing rain, heavy at times, with temperatures hovering near and below freezing today continue freezing rain and accumulating ice concerns this morning and again this afternoon. Ice reports have been limited overnight as surface temperatures have been at or slightly above freezing. Additional accumulation from a glaze to 0.25" is possible today north of Interstate 94.
Wet roads early this morning can quickly become slick to hazardous to dangerous with any ice accumulations. Check on road conditions and the latest forecasts before traveling. If your plans include locations north of Interstate 94, reconsider, alter or cancel them.
* WHAT...Additional snow and sleet accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations up to a quarter of an inch.
* WHERE...Taylor County.
* WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Significant ice accumulation on power lines and tree limbs may cause widespread and long-lasting power outages.
info.instruction: Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. Travel is highly discouraged due to slick roadways and the possibility of downed trees and power lines.

parameter.value: ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING
